title: MinecraftBot
details: Developed a Discord bot using Discord.js to allow server members to seamlessly start and stop a Minecraft server remotely.
Other features include: Requesting server IP, requesting server population, and facilitating admin commands.

title: CarePost
details: Developed an app using Android Studios to help maintain social distancing in apartment complexes during COVID-19 by allocating different package pickup times for the tenants.
The person delivering mail/packages will have to enter the apartment number and full name for the recipient.
At the end of the day, an office personal will press a button which automatically creates a pickup schedule for the next day.
The schedule is automatically loaded up to a mass email list, ready to be sent.

title: Offroad Vehicle
details: Built a vehicle with Raspberry Pi in Python which can be controlled using a phone and can display video feed and sensor values on a local network.
BlueDot application is used to control the speed and steering of the vehicle. It requires an Android phone with Bluetooth to operate.
A picamera is used to take a video feed of the car while it is on. Https.server class is used to display the video feed on a local network.

A Sense HAT is used to measure the temperature, humidity, pressure and acceleration of the car. Https.server class is used to display the data feed on a local network. At the end of the drive, pyplot is used to graph the data set for ease of data analysis.
Blue Robotics Basic ESC was used to control the speed of the brushless DC motor.

title: Portioning Gadget
details: Designed and manufactured a gadget prototype to help automatically portion raw ingredients for automated kitchens.
Arduino UNO was used to control a linear actuator to help with dispense portioned raw ingredients when required.
3D printed structures, such as brackets and funnels, were designed using AutoCAD and Fusion 360.
Laser-cut structures, such as support and containers, were designed using Inkscape.

title: F1 in Schools
details: A school project where we had to design, manufacture, and then race 3D-printed miniature compressed air powered cars.
AutoDesk AutoCAD was used to design the body and the wheels of the car.
AutoDesk Flow Design was used to simulate the final drag experienced by the car. These results were used to iteratively improve the aerodynamics of the car.

title: Better Guitar Tuner
details: Developed a guitar tuning app using Android Studio which accepts the pitch of a string as input and informs the user if they have to tighten or loosen the string to tune it properly.
TarsosDSP was used to process the audio in order to get the pitch of the strings.
A violin tuner as implemented afterwards as well.

title: Kirby Saves Christmas
details: Programmed a Mario-styled (2D side-scroller) platformer where the objective is to get from one point of the screen to another while jumping over obstacles.
Allegro library was used to implement the visuals, sprite animation and the GUI.
Levels were premade using a text file, which would later get compiled into a full level at runtime.
